page.title: 03TODDINGTON VILLAGE GREEN
page.content: A{landscape}feature in the centre of Toddington is the Village Green. The water pump (1855) remains. The garage was the old forge. The Memorial is a tribute to the dead of two World Wars. Around the Green are many{Georgian {houses}e.g. Wentworth House, which reflect the peak of prosperity of the once great market town. The{Town Hall, with its Elizabethan walls, still stands, although unused and neglected. Next to the Town Hall is a wall of Flemish Bond Brickwork which was once the lower storey of the Cloisters. The Oddfellows Arms, Bell and Red Lion are old{Inns}still serving refreshment to passers by. The electric station, once the animal pound, and a gas house are to be found on the Green. The library is the most modern building on the Green. It stands on the site of an old bakery.Fetes are held on the Green.
